TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SoapParameterStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies how parameters are formatted in a SOAP message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle> can be set when applying a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> to an XML Web service method or a method of a client proxy class. The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle> can also be set by applying a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentServiceAttribute> to a class implementing an XML Web service.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle Bare = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Parameters sent to and from an XML Web service method are placed in XML elements directly following the element of a SOAP request or SOAP response.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies using the default for the XML Web service. The default for an XML Web service can be set by applying a to the class implementing the XML Web service. If a is not applied to the class implementing the XML Web service, the default is .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle Wrapped = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Parameters sent to and from an XML Web service method are encapsulated within a single XML element followig the element of the XML portion of a SOAP request or SOAP response.
